CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's mother had a share in a plot of agricultural land . The land is located in LOC and is registered as plot number CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . In DATE the Bardejov local authority ( NORP národný výbor ) assigned the “ right of use ” in respect of the plot to ORG ( Štátny majetok ) .
CARDINAL . The right of use was later conferred on ORG and , under a DATE contract on ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP The area where the plot is located was turned into a “ garden community ” named PERSON and consisting of individual gardens which were put at the disposal of members of ORG ( “ the gardeners ” ) . The plot has been used as such a garden area since . It is situated outside the built - up area of LOC and it has been entered in the land register as arable land .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an inheritance decree confirming that the ownership of QUANTITY of land in the above plot had devolved to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE special legislation on the use of plots of land in allotment gardens and arrangements as regards their ownership ( PERSON o užívaní pozemkov v zriadených záhradkových osadách a vyporiadaní vlastníctva k nim – “ PERSON no . CARDINAL ” ) entered into force ( see “ Relevant domestic law and practice ” below ) .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL , if no other arrangement has been made between an owner and a tenant of land in a garden community , their relation would become ex lege that of the parties to a lease . The applicant attempted twice to terminate the lease of her land by notice . She argued that , despite her efforts , no fair agreement concerning the use of the plot had been reached and that the statute used for the calculation of the rent in the absence of an agreement was outdated . Moreover , ORG was in any event in default of payment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant sued the gardeners before ORG . She claimed that the defendant should be obliged to conclude a lease contract with her and pay CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) as rent . On DATE ORG rejected the action as the defendant , as indicated in the applicant 's action , lacked standing in the case . On DATE the ORG upheld the first - instance judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant , with reference to sections CARDINAL CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL , that rent payable by the gardeners amounted to PERCENT of the value of the land , determined pursuant to LAW . In any event , the minimum rent was SKK CARDINAL.CARDINAL per square metre .

CARDINAL . In DATE the gardeners sent SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the applicant as rent for DATE . In DATE the gardeners paid another SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL to the applicant as rent for DATE . Those sums correspond approximately to FAC per square QUANTITY a year .

CARDINAL . NORP In letters of DATE and DATE the applicant informed the gardeners that the sums paid were inadequate in view of the actual value of her land and that no agreement had been reached between her and the gardeners as to the lease of the land . It appears from the applicant 's submission of CARDINAL DATE that DATE the gardeners had paid to her the overall sum of SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL as rent for the use of her land .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the gardeners requested that the ownership relations in respect of their gardens be settled in a procedure under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of Law no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG formally announced the commencement of a land consolidation procedure in respect of the gardens in question . The announcement contained a register of the original ownership and a surveyor 's plan concerning the current state ( “ the preliminary inventory ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the preliminary inventory , opposing the consolidation procedure as such and claiming possession of the original plot .

CARDINAL . The challenge was dismissed by ORG on DATE . The administrative authority noted that the gardeners had proposed to buy the applicant 's land for SKK QUANTITY and that the applicant had declined that offer in that she had claimed SKK CARDINAL . As to the applicant 's arguments under LAW DATE , the authority noted that that piece of legislation ( and namely section GPE ) ) had ceased to be applicable to the land issue following the entry into force of PERSON no . CARDINAL on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant appealed . On DATE the ORG quashed ORG decision on the ground that it had not checked whether there were valid contracts on the use of the land entitling the gardeners to request its transfer under PERSON no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . In a new decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant 's objection to the preliminary inventory . It was noted , inter alia , that the applicant had no power to terminate the lease . No agreement had been reached between the owner and the gardeners on the transfer of the land in issue . On the basis of the contracts on use of the land included in the file ORG was satisfied that the users of the land were entitled to request a consolidation procedure under PERSON no . CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . She claimed that the land should have been returned to her and requested that the rent payable by the gardeners should be determined .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal . The decision stated that LAW DATE had ceased to be applicable after enactment of Law no . CARDINAL . Any outstanding issues concerning the rent of the land fell to be determined by a court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG approved the preliminary inventory . The applicant challenged the approval by an administrative appeal , arguing that LAW no . CARDINAL was unconstitutional . She demanded that the consolidation be carried out according to market economy principles .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE . It noted that conformity with LAW no . CARDINAL had been already examined and confirmed by ORG and that the consolidation procedure had been conducted in compliance with that LAW .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG invited the applicant to present her position by stating whether she preferred to be compensated for her title in the plot by being granted a substitute plot or paid an amount of money in lieu . The letter indicated that the applicant owned QUANTITY of land in the garden community concerned . The value of the land pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL was SKK CARDINAL . Given that the land was located in a town which was a spa , the compensation was to be increased by PERCENT to reach SKK QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . NORP In response , the applicant rejected the proposed options and reiterated her request for her plot to be restored to her . As to the proposed financial compensation , she objected that it was inadequate .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ruled that the applicant was to be financially compensated for her title to the plot . It was observed that she had made no claim for substitute land in which case , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(a ) of Law no . CARDINAL , the compensation was automatically to be financial . The decision stated that the applicant owned QUANTITY of land in the area concerned and that she would receive FAC ( that is SKK CARDINAL.CARDINAL , which is equivalent to ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL , per square metre ) in compensation .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG informed the land owners of the details of the consolidation project under LAW no . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's objection to the project . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal against that decision . The authorities established that the applicant had claimed that LAW DATE be applied and that her purchase price should be determined on the basis of its market value .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG in which she challenged the decision of ORG . On CARDINAL DATE she extended her claim in that she challenged the above ORG decisions of DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings concerning ORG decisions of DATE and DATE as the action had been lodged outside the statutory DATE time - limit . It dismissed the claim concerning the decision of ORG DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG noted that in her action the applicant had claimed that the contested administrative decisions were unlawful on the ground that the administrative authorities had failed to correctly and reliably establish the relevant facts . The decision stated that the applicant had failed to specify , as required by the law , on the basis of which particular facts she considered the law to have been breached in the proceedings leading to the decision of ORG . The applicant rather expressed her disagreement with the land consolidation procedure as such and the amount of compensation offered to her in that context .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , ORG in Bardejov approved the land consolidation project under LAW no . CARDINAL . The decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the same authority ordered implementation of the land consolidation project pursuant to section CARDINAL ) of Law no . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in Prešov upheld that decision . It noted that the applicant had challenged the decision of DATE without submitting any reason for her appeal . She had merely stated that she had made an application to ORG . At a later stage the applicant had requested that the administrative authorities should proceed pursuant to LAW DATE and that the ownership rights in respect of the land should be determined in accordance with LAW .

CARDINAL . The regional land office noted that in the context of the consolidation proceedings the compensation for the landowners had been determined by a decision which had become final on DATE . None of the land owners had sought judicial review . Adequacy and form of compensation to be provided to land owners could therefore no longer be addressed in the subsequent proceedings , which concerned the implementation of the consolidation project .
CARDINAL . On DATE a real estate agency issued a certificate , at the applicant 's request , according to which the approximate value of the applicant 's land is EUR QUANTITY .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at the ORG 's request , ORG in GPE submitted an opinion according to which the market value of the applicant 's land is ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL per square metre . The opinion states that the land is located in the area of the town of Bardejov and that it has not been planned to use it for construction purposes according to the current plans . Furthermore , the land is in a zone of environmental protection of water resources whereby its use for purposes other than gardening is considerably affected .
CARDINAL . In a reaction to the latter valuation the applicant proposed that the ORG should accept that the value of her land was ORG CARDINAL per square metre .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law and practice , as well as the general background to consolidation of land used by garden communities , are set out in GPE obec PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE and DATE , ORG DATE ... ( extracts ) ) .

CARDINAL . As from DATE , after Regulation CARDINAL/CARDINAL had been repealed ( see GPE obec PERSON , cited above , § DATE ) , sections PERSON ) and CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL have provided for the value of the land in the allotments to be determined in accordance with a special law . In particular , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) has fixed the rent at PERCENT of its value thus determined . Reference is made to LAW DATE , as amended . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of that Act empowers ORG to issue a binding regulation in that respect .

CARDINAL . Such regulation was enacted with effect from DATE ( Regulation CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . In it valuation is based on a scheme of “ quality pedo - ecological units ” ( bonitované pôdno - ekologické jednotky ) categorising agricultural land and other areas in GPE . Section CARDINAL ) provides that such valuation is applicable also to gardens located outside a municipality 's constructed area . The scheme provides for value of agricultural land within a range from ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL to EUR CARDINAL.CARDINAL FAC ) . Pursuant to Annex CARDINAL , the value of a particular plot is determined by multiplying the unitary value as set out in FAC by its surface area .
CARDINAL . In addition , the following legal provisions and practice are relevant in the present case .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW provides that constitutional laws , laws and other generally binding legal regulations are to be interpreted and applied in conformity with LAW .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to Article CARDINALc § CARDINAL of the LAW , international treaties on human rights and fundamental freedoms which GPE has ratified and which have been promulgated in the manner laid down by a law prior to the entry into LAW on DATE form a part of its legal order and have precedence over laws where they provide for a broader array of constitutional rights and freedoms .

CARDINAL . In judgment ORG CARDINAL delivered on DATE ORG , with reference to LAW and CARDINALc § CARDINAL of the LAW , held that the LAW and the case - law of its bodies represent binding guidelines for national authorities on interpretation and implementation of legal provisions with a bearing on fundamental rights and freedoms . The LAW and the case - law of its organs thus set a framework which the national authorities could not overstep when dealing with a case . The same view was expressed in its judgment ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered a judgment in proceedings III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The case concerned alleged flaws in proceedings on implementation of a consolidation project under PERSON no . CARDINAL . In particular , the plaintiff complained that by its decision to discontinue the proceedings concerning lawfulness of the administrative authorities ' decisions a court had breached his rights to judicial protection and to own property .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court granted the complaint considering that the court should have dealt with the merits of the case . It returned the case to the ordinary court for further proceedings .
